job.title: Software Engineer
job.description: <p><strong>Position:</strong> Software Engineer IV</p><p><strong>Location:</strong> Raleigh, North Carolina</p><p><strong>Duration:</strong> Full-time, Permanent</p><p><strong>Start:</strong> ASAP</p><p><strong>Pay:</strong> COMPETITIVE</p><p><br></p><p><strong><em>This position performs complex research, design, and software development assignments within a software functional area or product line, and provides direct input to project plans, schedules, and methodology in the development of cross-functional software products. This position performs software design — typically across multiple systems; mentors more-junior members of the team; and talks to users/customers and translates their requests into solutions.</em></strong></p><p><br></p><p><strong><u> MUST HAVE QUALIFICATIONS:</u></strong></p><p>• 5+ years of Software Engineering experience</p><p>• BS Engineering/Computer Science or equivalent experience required</p><p><br></p><p><strong><u> MUST HAVE TECHNICAL SKILLS:</u></strong></p><p>• Advanced knowledge of software development methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall).</p><p>• Strong proficiency with data manipulation language including optimization techniques.</p><p>• Strong understanding of normalized/dimensional data modeling principles.</p><p>• Strong knowledge of multiple data storage subsystems.</p><p>• Expertise (emphasis in bold) in development languages including but not limited to: C#, Java/J2EE, JavaScript, JSP, C/C++, HTML, XML, SQL, Windows, UNIX, and .Net.</p><p>• Strong research skills.</p><p>• Strong knowledge in industry best practices in development.</p><p>• Knowledge in using and developing applicable tool sets.</p><p>• Ability to interface competently with other technical personnel or team members to finalize requirements.</p><p>• Ability to work well with internal and external technology resources.</p><p>• Knowledge of test-driven development.</p><p>• Ability to write and review portions of detailed specifications for the development of complex system components.</p><p>• Ability to complete complex bug fixes.</p><p>• Good oral and written communications skills.</p><p><br></p><p><strong><u>MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:</u></strong></p><p>• Interface with other technical personnel or team members to finalize requirements.</p><p>• Write and review portions of detailed specifications for the development of complex system components.</p><p>• Complete complex bug fixes.</p><p>• Work closely with other development team members to understand complex product requirements and translate them into software designs.</p><p>• Successfully implement development processes, coding best practices, and code reviews.</p><p>• Operate in various development environments (Agile, Waterfall, etc.) while collaborating with key stakeholders.</p><p>• Resolve complex technical issues as necessary.</p><p>• Train entry-level software engineers as directed by department management, ensuring they are knowledgeable in critical aspects of their roles.</p><p>• Keep abreast of new technology developments.</p><p>• Design and work with complex data models.</p><p>• Mentor less-senior software developers on development methodologies and optimization techniques.</p><p>• All other duties as assigned</p>
